design_intent.player_goal: Master Endpoint Security for SY0-701 using campaign and roguelike runs.

trap_list.name: Secure Boot vs Measured Boot
trap_list.misconception: Thinking both mechanisms block untrusted boot components.
trap_list.fix: Secure Boot validates signatures and can block; Measured Boot records hashes for attestation and policy decisions after measurement.

trap_list.name: EDR vs XDR
trap_list.misconception: Believing XDR is just a rebrand of EDR.
trap_list.fix: EDR focuses on endpoints + correlated logs; XDR broadens telemetry/analytics across the tech stack (cloud/email/platforms) for cross-domain detection and response.

trap_list.name: Allow List vs Block List
trap_list.misconception: Assuming block lists provide the same security as allow lists.
trap_list.fix: Allow lists default-deny (only approved runs); block lists default-allow (deny known-bad) and can miss new/unknown threats.

trap_list.name: HIPS vs HIDS
trap_list.misconception: Thinking both systems actively stop attacks.
trap_list.fix: HIDS detects and alerts; HIPS can block/prevent suspicious traffic/actions before the host processes them.

trap_list.name: TPM vs HSM vs KMS
trap_list.misconception: Treating all key-related tech as interchangeable.
trap_list.fix: TPM anchors platform trust on a device; HSM is a dedicated key device for many systems (often certified); KMS is typically a centralized (often cloud) service for keys/secrets.

trap_list.name: SSD Wiping vs Crypto Erase
trap_list.misconception: Assuming overwrite wipes are always enough on SSDs.
trap_list.fix: SSD wear-leveling can leave remnants; use Secure Erase/vendor tools, or encrypt for life and destroy the key (crypto erase) when retiring.

missions.name: Mission 1: Boot, Trust, and Lifecycle Risks
missions.goal: Spot endpoint risk from insecure defaults, lifecycle states, and hardware-level threats. Then lock the boot chain to known-good trust anchors.

missions.name: Mission 2: Endpoint Defense Stack
missions.goal: Build the layered endpoint defense stack: antimalware detection, allowlists, EDR/XDR visibility, DLP, and host-level controls.

missions.name: Mission 3: Hardening at Scale
missions.goal: Turn 'secure' from a vibe into a repeatable process: baselines, patch management, configuration enforcement, and OS policy controls.

boss.name: Boss Fight: Weird Endpoints & Data Retirement
boss.premise: Survive the endpoints you can't patch easily (ICS/IoT/RTOS) and safely retire what you can't keep.

constraint_cards.name: No Hints
constraint_cards.effect: Disable hints; require a 1-sentence justification for full points.
